medium_description_en: Calculates a corrected calcium level for patients with hypoalbuminemia.

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en: Patients with suspected hypocalcemia may have a "normal" calcium level resulted if their albumin is low. An alternative or additional confirmatory test for hypocalcemia is an ionized calcium level.

next_steps.advice_en: Patients with hypercalcemia may initially require volume resuscitation; loop diuretics can help with renal excretion of calcium, and bisphosphonates are also effective, especially in malignancy-related hypercalcemia.

about.formula_en:
Corrected Calcium = (0.8 * (Normal Albumin - Pt's Albumin)) + Serum Ca

Note: formula assumes albumin units in g/dL.

Validation.text: Parent X, et. al. Corrected calcium: calcium status underestimation in non-hypoalbuminemic patients and in hypercalcemic patients. Ann Biol Clin (Paris). 2009 Jul-Aug;67(4):411-8. doi: 10.1684/abc.2009.0348.

Original/Primary Reference.text: Payne RB, Little AJ, Williams RB, Milner JR. Interpretation of Serum Calcium in Patients with Abnormal Serum Proteins. British Medical Journal. 1973;4(5893):643-646

creator_info.about_en: Xavier Parent, MD, is a biochemist at Hôpitaux Civils de Colmar in France. He has published many articles on topics related to electrolyte and ionic reactions in the body.

seo.meta_description_en: The Calcium Correction for Hypoalbuminemia calculates a corrected calcium level for patients with hypoalbuminemia.
